Thanks for your reply, I have a question about the recover,
when I invokes =
the PHP webservice, the result is failured ,for example
the remote server c=
losed. I want to store the status of the failure URI, when the heritrix res=
tart, it could be invokes the PHP webservice again. how to implements it?

=



--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Kristinn Sigur=C3=B0sson <krists=
i@...> wrote:
>
> The standard way to accomplish what you describe is to cr=
eate a Processor that invokes the PHP webservice. This processor would then=
 be slotted into the processing chain right after the (W)ArcWriterProcessor=
. Each URI that is tried would then be passed through the processor and it =
could act accordingly. In Heritrix 3 you could alternatively wire in a bean=
 that listens for crawl uri disposition events (which are fired by the Fron=
tier).
> 
> There are some instructions for writing a custom processor for =
Heritrix 1 in the Developer Manual (http://crawler.archive.org/articles/dev=
eloper_manual/processor.html). This is however somewhat badly out of date f=
or Heritrix 3.
> 
> - Kris
>
